To solve this problem, follow these steps:

Step 1: Calculate the amount of usable microphones  
Condition 2 states that 20% of microphones cannot join pairs because of space issues. We start off knowing the Singer initially possessed 10115 Microphones (condition 1), so first thing we need to find out what counts as being unusable:   
UnusableMicrophoneCount=TotalInitialNumberOfMicrophones*PercentageUnsuitabilityForPairs / PercentagesAsWholeNumbersPercentsConvertedInDecimalValue    
=> UnusableMicrophoneCount = 10115*(20%)/(100)=2023      
Here, per cent denotes percentage which represents division into hundreds i.e., (per unit)/total units => Conversion Factor To Convert From Whole Number Per Cent Value To Actual Count As Fraction Is Required     
         Note : Here It Can Be Deduced That Units Are Equal While Performing Multiplication Or Division Operation Among Them !
